name: K+K Hotel Fenix

reviews.text: if you do not matter about location in something like "red light area" - but anyway close to Wenzel-platz this is a perfect hotel. Everything perfect.
reviews.title: top business hotel

reviews.text: We were a group of 11 people staying 4 nights in this hotel, I must stay we were all impressed by the quality of services provided by this hotel. From the reception staff to the breakfast staff,evrybody was brilliant, polite, ready to help. Good size rooms, maybe the only "negative remark" was the rack in the room, you had lot of space to hang up clothes but no flat surfaces to dispose the other clothes. Breakfast choice was more than good and, bit of luxury, served until 12:00 on the weekends, which is very convenient when you went out late the night before...Free wifi all over the place. Very good location, close to Wenceslas Square, just don't pay attention to the cabarets around the hotel. To make it short : I can only recommend this place, for young or less young people. Special big THANKS for Lenka, your service in french was oustanding :)
reviews.title: Outstanding location and services, very good deal too !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is a few steps away from Wenceslas Square, 100m from the nearest Metro station (Muzeum), but within easy walking distance of the Old Town as well. Comfortable rooms and great breakfast buffet. Friendly and helpful staff everywhere. There is no restaurant in the hotel, but plenty of choice both around the corner and in the Old Town.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel for both business and pleasure traveller

reviews.text: Free Wifi all over the place!
reviews.title: Perfect business hotel. Excellent service, great breakfast, possibly the cleanest hotel I have ever stayed in.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for just one night but long enough to appreciate the place. Asked for and received a quiet room. Good size room with free wifi and business centre. No time to use gym etc. excellent breakfast choice, friendly and helpful staff. I did not find the clubs etc a problem that other reviewers did. Location just off Wenceslas square.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel to stay at in Prague

reviews.text: Everything was perfect during our stay in this hotel.
reviews.title: Just perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Its location is very convenient, in a few steps from Wenceslas Square.
reviews.title: Perfect for a city break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was very friendly and courteous.
reviews.title: Christmas markets

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was nice and clean. Minibar was equipped with a kettle and tea bags. So we could drink some tea in the room at any time and it was free.
reviews.title: Good hotel in the heart of Prague

reviews.text: Breakfasts were great! There was an abundant of fruit, tinned, dried and fresh, sausages and cheeses, vegetables, cereals and juices. There was black coffee (Americano) and a variety of tea in bags (Ronenfeld).
reviews.title: excellent place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights including New Year's Eve. We got a good rate on Hotwire.com. We were highly satisfied with the hotel - smooth check-in and checkout, sumptuous buffet breakfast with generous hours (generally until 11 a.m., but on 1 January breakfast was served until 1 p.m., recognizing that most people were up until the wee hours of the morning celebrating New Year's Eve), and clean, comfortable, and tastefully furnished rooms. We were able to check-in upon arrival around 12 noon even if the published check-in time is 2 p.m. Housekeeping did not have problems with cleaning our room even if we left our room relatively late in the morning, sometimes past 10 a.m.There is a great selection of complimentary instant coffee and tea bags in the room with a water kettle, and the mini-bar is well-stocked with items for purchase.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel

reviews.text: Being meat lovers, we thoroughly enjoyed the buffet breakfast. There were sausages, bacon, a wide selection of cold cuts, hard boiled and scrambled eggs, along with fruits, a superb collection of fine cheese including blue cheese and camembert, and the usual fare of cereal, muesli, bread, butter, jam, etc. I'm not sure how many people enjoy champagne at breakfast, but there was always some available at the buffet table.
reviews.title: Central Excellence !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were told that there was a fitness center and a spa/sauna at the hotel, but we did not visit them. Massages can be booked at any time of the day, as long as you do so at least 2 hours in advance.
reviews.title: very nice stay.
Great choice for both business and leisure visitors!
reviews.text: If I were to nitpick about the room I would just point out that the flatscreen TV is rather small but I expect most visitors to Prague will not spend much time watching TV anyway. It would also have been nice to have some extra outlets in the room as we had to unplug the sidetable lamps in order to charge our phones and camera. There was just one unused outlet by the foot of the bed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We made sure to email ahead of our arrival to request for a quiet room facing away from the street and the lifts, so we had no problems with noise even with fireworks still being set off by revelers on Wenceslas Square when we returned to our room on New Year's Eve. Note, however, that rooms facing away from the street will not have much of a view and you will just be looking out onto another building. As the other reviews have pointed out, there are two cabaret clubs next to and across the hotel, so there is a dodgy feel to the street as you walk down to the hotel from Wenceslas Square at night, but we were not bothered by the clubs' touts and guests. The location of the hotel is otherwise great, as it's just a short walk to Wenceslas Square and on to the Old Town Square. One-way 90-minute tickets for public transport can be purchased from the hotel reception, but other tickets have to be purchased from "tabacs" or metro stations (you will need coins for the ticket machines at metro stations). The Muzeum metro stop is close by.
reviews.title: Peaceful sleep every night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the hotel for the last week of January and couldn't find a single thing to complain about!! The staff were unbelievably helpful and friendly and any advice they gave was perfect and helped to make our stay so enjoyable. From the time we were collected from the airport by one of the hotel's drivers we spelt special and this continued for the rest of the week. The kind gesture of a bottle of champagne in our room on arrival as part of our celebration was also much appreciated. Our room was at the back of the hotel and was extremely clean and had everything we needed. The bed was very comfortable and when we requested an extra pillow it was provided immediately. The room was kept immaculately clean and tidy by daily cleaning service. The morning breakfast spread was again impressive! Fruit juices, yoghurts, fresh fruits, cereals, nuts, cold meats, cheeses, hot bacon,sauages,eggs,mushrooms and a selection of breads, biscuits and cakes. Endless tea or coffee served by friendly and attentive staff. Then all this topped off with a glass of champagne.
reviews.title: No complaints!!
Great location, superb hotel, great staff
reviews.text: We had read other reviews about the close proximity to the two strip clubs but they were not an issue at all. The guys outside encouraging customers never once bothered my wife or I and we didn't feel intimidated at all and were quite happy to walk up and down at any time. We experienced no noise from the clubs during the evening or throughout he night.
We would recommend this hotel and would like to thank all the staff for making our visit to Prague such an enjoyable and positive experience.
reviews.title: Good, not great, hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fourth stay here and still cannot believe how good this hotel is for the money.
reviews.title: Hotel k & k fenix prague

reviews.text: Location is ideal, though you may want a room at the back as the noise from the two strip clubs nearby can be annoying.
reviews.title: Excellent, perfect hotel for short vacation

description: This first class hotel, a remarkable architectural landmark, enjoys an excellent location in quiet surroundings, just a few steps from lively Wenceslas Square, the "Golden City's" centre with all its wonderful sights, museums, shops and restaurants. As all K+K Hotels, it offers state-of-the-art amenities, elegantly furbished guestrooms and combines contemporary interior design and the best of traditional hospitality. Free WiFi in all guest rooms and public area. Free access to the Internet Lounge (PCs, printer and international newspapers). Free access to the Wellness Area with gym and sauna. Complimentary coffee and tea making facilities in the rooms.
